text: was a town in Japan in the Abuta (Iburi) District of Iburi Subprefecture, Hokkaido. As of 2004, the town had an estimated population of 7,811 and a density of 116.84 persons per km2. The total area was 66.85 km2. On March 27, 2006, Abuta was merged with the village of Tōya (also from Abuta (Iburi) District) to create the new town of Tōyako. ==External links== * Tōyako official website Category:Dissolved municipalities of Hokkaido
title: Abuta, Hokkaido
